snippet: O. Aldon James Jr., his twin brother, John, and a friend, Steven U. Leitner, agreed to move out of the club’s residence tower, and never again serve as officers of a nonprofit organization in New York.
abstract: O Aldon James Jr, embattled former head of  National Arts Club, whose 25-year tenure was marked by charges of bullying, animal cruelty, compulsive hoarding and gross financial self-dealing, agrees to pay $950,000, ending lawsuit brought by New York State Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman; James also agrees to move out of club’s residence tower, and never again serve as officer of a nonprofit organization in New York.
lead_paragraph: O. Aldon James Jr., his twin brother, John, and a friend, Steven U. Leitner, agreed to move out of the club’s residence tower, and never again serve as officers of a nonprofit organization in New York.

headline.main: National Arts Club Ex-President Settles Suit and Agrees to Pay $950,000
headline.print_headline: National Arts Club Ex-President Settles Suit and Agrees to Pay $950,000
